executive_summary: Sanket is a 43-year-old male with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus (T1DM) diagnosed in 2022. His current HbA1c is 8.0%, indicating a need for improved glycemic control, alongside monitoring for cardiovascular risk factors given his lipid profile and blood pressure.

clinical_context.recent_events: 2 episodes of hypoglycemia in the last 90 days

interpretation.assessment: Current HbA1c of 8.0% indicates suboptimal glycemic control.
interpretation.plan: Consider initiation of insulin therapy or adjustment of current regimen to achieve target HbA1c.

interpretation.assessment: LDL is above target for high-risk patients.
interpretation.plan: Implement dietary changes and consider statin therapy.

lifestyle_plan.text: Increase physical activity to at least 150 minutes of moderate exercise per week.
Limit alcohol intake to no more than 14 units per week.

diet_plan.principles: Focus on a balanced diet rich in whole grains, lean proteins, fruits, and vegetables while reducing saturated fats and sugars.
sample_meals: Grilled chicken salad with mixed greens and vinaigrette
Oatmeal topped with berries and a sprinkle of nuts
Baked salmon with quinoa and steamed broccoli
diet_plan.portion_guidance: Use the plate method: half the plate for vegetables, a quarter for protein, and a quarter for whole grains.

monitoring_plan.glucose_targets: Aim for pre-meal glucose levels of 4-7 mmol/L.
monitoring_plan.testing_frequency: Test blood glucose levels at least 4 times a day.
monitoring_plan.safety_checks: Regularly check for signs of hypoglycemia, especially with increased activity.

patient_goals: Reduce LDL cholesterol to < 2.0 mmol/L within 12 months.
Increase physical activity to 150 minutes per week within 3 months.

medication_plan.text: Consider starting insulin therapy to improve glycemic control.
Consider statin therapy for LDL management.

follow_up.actions: Reassess HbA1c, lipid levels, and overall diabetes management plan.

emr_note: Patient is a 43-year-old male with T1DM, currently with an HbA1c of 8.0%. Recommendations include lifestyle modifications, potential initiation of insulin therapy, and monitoring of lipid levels.
